intro: Euphrasia nemorosa subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western wood betony, is a perennial herb native to western North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and rocky habitats. The plant features whorled, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent, spurred petals. It is part of the Scrophulariaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value. Its delicate appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native range.
